timeline.summary: Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email on February 19, 2019, to [REDACTED] requesting detailed briefing memos regarding Epstein, to be delivered by Thursday morning from the Chief Public Corruption Unit of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The email included a reference to file EFTA00027926.

A communication regarding detailed briefing memos was sent on February 19, 2019, from the Chief Public Corruption Unit of the United States Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York to Geoffrey Berman and others. The memo requested teams provide the briefings by Thursday morning, covering information related to Epstein.

This email, dated February 21, 2019, from the Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney, SDNY, to Geoffrey Berman, SANYS, discusses a new ruling related to Epstein. The email includes a link to a Miami Herald article regarding the ruling.

On February 21, 2019, a message was forwarded regarding a new Epstein ruling, accessible via a Miami Herald article. The message originated from a U.S. Attorney’s Office, SDNY, and was sent to Geoffrey Berman. The document references EFTA00024714.

This email thread discusses the aftermath of a hearing related to Jeffrey Epstein. It involves multiple individuals and organizations, including USANYS, NDGA, and the Miami Herald. A request is made to circulate NDGA papers, and a link to a news article about the hearing is shared. Geoffrey Berman, a Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney, SDNY, is also involved.

On June 28, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) received an email from [REDACTED] regarding an "Accepted: Epstein Press Meeting." The email was sent from [REDACTED] to Berman and attached was a file named EFTA00010580.
Geoffrey Berman received an automatic reply from someone regarding Epstein and JMD Media Guideline on June 28, 2019. The sender was out of the office and directed inquiries to contact either  or .

On 2019-07-01 from 20:00 to 21:00, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) organized the “Epstein Press Meeting” at the 8th Floor Library. The event was classified as X-PERSONAL. The record was created on 2019-06-28 and last modified on the same date.

Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) requested a copy of the indictment (referred to as “JE, first indictment.docx”) from an unknown recipient. The attachment was provided on July 1, 2019, and was subject to a final proof-read.
On 2019-07-01 from 20:00 to 21:00, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) organized the “Epstein Press Meeting” at the 8th Floor Library. The event was classified as X-PERSONAL.

On July 1, 2019, a communication was sent from [REDACTED] to Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) regarding an “Epstein Press Meeting.” The email was marked as “Normal” importance and contained an unnamed attachment, designated as EFTA00021268.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) on July 6, 2019, regarding draft press materials related to Jeffrey Epstein. The sender stated they would pass the materials to their team. Documents EFTA00029510 and EFTA00029511 are also present.

On July 6, 2019, correspondence occurred between individuals associated with “USANYS” (identified as [REDACTED]) regarding draft press materials related to Jeffrey Epstein. Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) forwarded the materials, and discussions continued between multiple parties using the identifiers EFTA00032581 and EFTA00032582.

On July 6, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email update to multiple recipients regarding the investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. Judge Moses signed a search warrant, and the FBI received a flight manifest indicating Epstein and two pilots were scheduled to travel. Confirmation of the passengers was pending after the flight took off.

Geoffrey Berman, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, forwarded updates regarding the Epstein case. Judge Moses signed a search warrant, and the FBI received a flight manifest from CBP listing Jeffrey Epstein and two pilots. The information is subject to change, and the FBI intends to confirm passenger details after the flight departs.

On July 6, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent updates regarding the investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. A search warrant was signed by Judge Moses, and FBI received a flight manifest listing Epstein and two pilots. The team successfully conducted a covert investigation resulting in an indictment.

On July 6, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email update to multiple recipients regarding an investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The update included the following key information: Judge Moses signed a search warrant, FBI received a flight manifest listing Epstein and two pilots from CBP, and the FBI is attempting to confirm the passengers after the flight takes off. Laura Birger (USANYS) and Audrey Strauss (USANYS) were also involved in the communication.

On July 6, 2019, Judge Moses signed a search warrant related to Epstein. The FBI received a flight manifest from CBP listing Epstein and two pilots. Agents were preparing to execute search warrants and were available to assist with supplemental warrants if needed. Geoffrey Berman, an Assistant United States Attorney, reported that Epstein was confirmed on board a flight.

Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) received a message from “[REDACTED]” regarding the “Epstein Proposed Press Remarks v3 (large).docx” document (EFTA00028282). The exchange included the message “Awesome, thanks.”

An email chain discusses a final Public Relations (PR) review for a case related to Jeffery Epstein. The FBI Assistant Director stated a request for anyone who may have been victimized by Epstein or has information about his alleged criminal behavior to contact the FBI at 1-800-CALL-FBI. A final PR document was attached and requires finalizing the inclusion of the phone number. The email correspondence involves individuals from the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York and Geoffrey Berman.

This document records Jeffrey Epstein’s initial appearance in the Southern District of New York on July 8, 2019, following his arrest on July 6, 2019. United States Attorney Geoffrey Berman and defense attorneys Reid Weingarten, Martin Weinberg, and Marc Fernich appeared on behalf of the prosecution and defendant, respectively. Epstein is charged with two counts: sex trafficking conspiracy and the substantive offense of sex trafficking, allegedly involving the sexual abuse of underage girls at his residences in New York and Florida. The court explained Epstein’s rights as a defendant, and the government sought detention pending trial, citing significant risk of flight and danger due to Epstein’s wealth, international travel, and previous offenses. The defense argued that the charges were based on old conduct and that the non-prosecution agreement in Florida was not applicable, requesting a continuance to present their case. The court scheduled a detention hearing for July 11, 2019, at 2:00 PM, and ordered Epstein to be detained.

Geoffrey Berman sent an email to Jean James on July 12, 2019, regarding a forwarded email titled "VIDEO CHILD SEX TRAFFICKING - JEFFREY EPSTEIN CONNECTIONS" (EFTA00029522). The email was marked as “Normal” importance.

An email chain discusses the potential involvement of Curcio due to his son's employment. Geoffrey Berman reported a conversation with Reid Weingarten, who indicated his client might contact the team and that his son believed the sex trafficking statute was broad.

An email chain discusses concerns regarding a bail statement related to Jeffrey Epstein. Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) inquired about the concern, leading to a conversation with [REDACTED] who expressed misgivings about statements concerning detention. The sender agreed with this position. The email chain includes references to a tip line investigation and a previous statement made on Monday.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York and pronounced dead at a local hospital due to an apparent suicide. He was 66 years old and incarcerated on sex trafficking and conspiracy charges. The FBI is investigating the incident. The MCC New York facility houses 763 male offenders.

On August 10, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) inquired about confirming information regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s death to the press, specifically asking if they should refer inquiries to the Bureau of Prisons (BOP). The sender of the initial email, [REDACTED], was attempting to contact BOP due to unanswered calls regarding the situation. Berman was located near the office and offered assistance.

A Justice Department employee (USANYS) forwarded an article from the Washington Examiner regarding an Epstein accuser’s anger over Jeffrey Epstein’s death and a desire for prosecution of his accomplices and enablers. The email originated from the U.S. Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York.

On August 10, 2019, multiple individuals communicated regarding news of Jeffrey Epstein’s death. The New York Post was reporting on the suicide, and initial discussions centered on awaiting statements from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) or U.S. Marshals Service (USMS). Geoffrey Berman, USANYS, received a call confirming Epstein’s suicide during transport to the hospital.

Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) received a message from [REDACTED] regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s reported suicide. The message stated that Epstein died on the way to the hospital after being informed of his suicide by an unknown source.

A message was sent from [REDACTED] to Geoffrey Berman regarding a Senate letter. The letter included a question (Question 4) and a PDF attachment titled “sasse-letter-to-ag-barr-re-epstein-suicide.pdf”. The sender requested a preliminary response to the question.

Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email to the FBI on August 12, 2019, requesting a call regarding case 19 cr 490 (Jeffrey Epstein). The email included an attachment – a letter from Judge Richard M. Berman – and a forwarded message from the United States Marshals Service (USMS) Southern District of New York, also concerning the same case.

On August 14, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, announced a tour for representatives from the Department of Justice and the SDNY USA0 on August 15, 2019, at 10:00 a.m. Attendees included the Principal Deputy Attorney General, Advisor at AG’s office, Geoffrey Berman, several Deputy US Attorneys, Chief of the Criminal Division, SDNY, Counsel to the US Attorney, Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, SDNY, and multiple AUSAs. The Supervisory Attorney requested notification of attendees’ arrival.

On August 14, 2019, discussions occurred regarding a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York involving Ed O’Callahan, Geoffrey Berman, and staff from the USANYS office. The visit was to include viewing specific areas, including observation and suicide watch areas, the SHU, and the cell of a particular individual (Epstein). A request was made for MCC legal to escort the visitors, and communication centered around logistical details such as arrival time, screening procedures, and potential entry points. There were prior issues with errors and a request to accompany the Warden on the tour.

A discussion occurred regarding a request from Geoffrey Berman, SDNY USA, to modify Victim Notification System (VNS) notices. Berman wanted the notices to consist solely of the introduction and added text, limiting them to two paragraphs. Attempts to achieve this through the VNS help desk were unsuccessful. The recipient was tasked with finding a solution to manipulate the notification to meet Berman's specific requirements, noting the urgency of the request.

On August 14, 2019, Geoffrey Berman, U.S. Attorney, sent a notification to Gloria Allred regarding Case Number 2018R01618 and Court Docket Number 19-CR-00490. The notification, provided by the U.S. Department of Justice Victim Notification System, explains that Jeffrey Epstein died in custody and the Department intends to seek dismissal of the indictment. However, the ongoing investigation necessitates continued outreach to potential victims and individuals with relevant information, encouraging contact with the FBI at 1-800-CALL-FBI. Wendy Olsen serves as the Victim Witness Coordinator for this case.

The email chain pertains to a planned visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York involving U.S. Department of Justice personnel, including Ed O’Callahan (Principal Deputy Attorney General), Geoffrey Berman (US Attorney), and supervisory staff attorneys from CLC New York. Discussions center around logistics for the visit, including visitor screening, specific areas to be viewed (2nd floor observation, 9th floor SHU, and Epstein’s cell), and the request for MCC legal staff to escort the group. Additional law enforcement agents (DO1) and the new acting warden are joining the visit. A request is made for the visitors to proceed to the front lobby for screening.

The document is a series of emails related to a planned visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) by US Attorney Geoffrey Berman and staff. Discussions involve coordinating the number and types of attendees (including paralegals and interns), arranging for law enforcement agents and a new acting warden to join the tour, and specifying the areas of interest for the visit (second floor observation areas, SHU, and Epstein’s cell). Requests were made for specific screening procedures and to limit interaction with guards due to ongoing investigations.

The email chain discusses a planned visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York involving multiple individuals, including Geoffrey Berman, Ed O’Callahan, and new staff. Discussions revolve around confirming the number of law enforcement agents attending, obtaining visitor titles, and arranging a tour focusing on specific areas (2nd floor observation, 9th floor SHU, and Epstein’s cell).  Requests are made for MCC legal staff to escort the visitors and to avoid interacting with guards due to ongoing investigations. A scheduling request of 10:00 AM is proposed.

The City Medical Examiner (OCME) has determined that Jeffrey Epstein’s cause of death was hanging and the manner of death was suicide. An official press release and death certificate reflecting this determination are scheduled to be released later that afternoon.

Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email inquiring about a report regarding Jeffrey Epstein, case number 19 cr 490. The United States Marshal, Southern District of New York, forwarded a letter from Judge Richard M. Berman regarding the same case. The email chain involved the FBI and the USMS.

Two individuals, M (USANYS) and Geoffrey Berman (USANYS), discussed the Epstein case. One party expressed pride in the team’s handling of the investigation and the opportunity it provided for victims to be heard, noting a positive response from NGOs and their own experience in court. The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York highlighted the case’s success in facilitating victim testimony and encouraged further reporting.

Geoffrey Berman, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, reports a positive response to the Epstein case from NGOs. This includes positive feedback on the charges and the opportunity for victims to be heard. Berman attended court proceedings and expressed pride in the Office's handling of the case, hoping it would encourage more victims to come forward. The email chain originates from multiple individuals within the USANYS office, including “[REDACTED]”.

David Rowlands contacted [REDACTED] regarding a potential claim for consultation fees owed by Jeffrey Epstein to his late father, John Kendall Rowlands, an art historian and collector. Rowlands alleges his father assisted Epstein with art sourcing and disposal, potentially loaned items, and was aware of young girls associated with Epstein. He requested communication with US Attorney Geoffrey Berman. Rowlands attached supporting documents including his passport, birth certificate, father’s death certificate, phone bill, and scans of related images (DavidR_Passport.jpeg, DavidR_Birth_certificate.jpeg, Dad_death_certificate.jpeg).

A communication from [REDACTED] to Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) regarding an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, supported by a submitted application for a nolle prosequi based on death. The email was sent on August 27, 2019.

The hearing was presided over by Judge Richard M. Berman, with representatives from the U.S. Attorney’s Office and defense counsel present. **Key Events and Participants:** *   **Initial Housekeeping:** Judge Berman addressed the participants, outlining the purpose of the hearing—to consider the motion to dismiss due to Epstein’s death. He also acknowledged the significant effort involved and expressed gratitude for the work of the prosecutors and victims. *   **Government’s Argument:** The government, led by Geoffrey Berman, argued that the death of Epstein necessitated the dismissal of the case due to the lack of a live defendant. They emphasized the need for a full and transparent investigation and highlighted the potential for further investigation into co-conspirators. They referenced the legal precedent set by the *U.S. v. Wright* case concerning abatement. *   **Defense’s Argument:** Defense counsel, led by Reid Weingarten, strongly opposed the dismissal, arguing that the court had an inherent authority to continue investigating and pursuing justice, regardless of Epstein's death. They raised concerns about the government’s handling of the investigation and questioned the credibility of the medical examiner’s findings regarding the cause of death. They invoked precedent from *U.S. v. Heaton* and suggested the possibility of a parallel investigation by the court. *   **Victim Testimonies:** Multiple Jane Doe victims, represented by Gloria Allred’s firm, offered statements detailing their experiences and the ongoing trauma caused by Epstein’s actions. They expressed a desire for justice and accountability. *   **Legal Discussions:** Throughout the hearing, the lawyers discussed relevant legal principles, including the “abatement” doctrine, the Crime Victims' Rights Act, and the role of the government in investigating and prosecuting crimes. The discussion centered on the court’s authority to continue the case despite Epstein's death. **Outcome (as presented):** The hearing concluded with Judge Berman stating that he would consider the arguments and would likely move forward with an inquiry into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death, reinforcing the importance of victims’ rights and ongoing investigation. **Additional Notes:** *   The text contains several references to ongoing investigations and potential further legal action. *   There were discussions regarding the handling of evidence, the role of the FBI, and the need for transparency in the investigation. *   The hearing showcased the complex legal and ethical issues involved in a case where the defendant has died before a trial concludes.

Jean James sent an email to Geoffrey Berman Cza on September 3, 2019, regarding a British Freedom of Information Request related to Jeffrey Epstein and Parliament. The email referenced a leaked set of emails provided to The Daily Mail, identified as EFTA00032299.

A communication between [REDACTED] (USANYS Contractor) and Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) regarding Epstein accusers, including a document named “Epstein_Accusers.docx”. The communication occurred on December 5, 2019.

Geoffrey Berman, of the USANYS, sent an email recommending a subpoena be issued to Jeffrey Epstein’s estate and executors to obtain surveillance camera footage from his New Mexico estates. He attached a link to a Daily Mail article featuring photographs of Epstein’s ranch showing an eight-person party with suspected pedophiles.

Geoffrey Berman sent an email to an unidentified recipient on December 27, 2019, referencing a CNBC article about Ghislaine Maxwell being under FBI investigation due to her friendship with Jeffrey Epstein. He requested a call when he had a chance.

Ghislaine Maxwell, a friend of Jeffrey Epstein, is currently under investigation by the FBI. This information was sent from Nicholas Blase of USANYS to Mimmie, James, Berman, and Geoffrey Berman on December 27, 2019, referencing a CNBC article about the investigation.
Geoffrey Berman, writing from the USANYS, reported a statement from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The victim stated that Maxwell coached her on how to please Jeffrey Epstein.
Geoffrey Berman inquired about sending a “Epstein pros memo” to an individual at USANYS (identified as a contractor). A redacted sender also requested permission to send the same memo to Berman.

An email thread between Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) and an unknown sender regarding a meeting titled “Epstein.” The sender expresses gratitude for Berman’s contributions, noting a positive and universally shared sentiment regarding the meeting and Berman’s handling of it.

On January 28, 2020, Daniel Bates contacted Lewis Pennock regarding a story planned for the Daily Mail and MailOnline about Andrew, who claims he hasn't been approached. Bates noted a contradiction between Andrew’s statement and Geoffrey Berman’s statement as the US Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Bates inquired about how the contact with Andrew was initiated. An attached PDF, EFTA00016810, is present.

An FBI email chain, dated January 29, 2020, and February 7, 2020, discusses a medical list provided by a Victim Services Manager within the FBI Region. The email thread involves the (NY) and (RO) (FBI) offices and includes a reference to a previous, unusual interaction involving Geoffrey Berman. The medical list contains psychological services and a discussion about connecting the recipients with a therapist.

A contractor (USANYS) sent a summary/analysis of Epstein trust documents to Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) on January 30, 2020. The analysis incorporates prior 2019 analysis and includes a document organized by trust with chronological amendments, key tabs, and summary tabs. The contractor advised against printing the document due to its size.

Prince Andrew denied claims from Geoffrey Berman, U.S. Attorney for Manhattan, that he refused to cooperate with the FBI in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. Andrew stated no requests had been made, while Berman’s office maintained they had made multiple attempts to contact Andrew’s representatives. Andrew expressed anger and bewilderment regarding the allegations, and a source close to him stated he was awaiting contact from the FBI. Law enforcement sources affirmed Berman’s claims. Duncan Levin, a former prosecutor, viewed the situation as evidence of the authorities’ determination to investigate the complex network surrounding Epstein.

*   A firm, Blackfords LLP, is assisting the Duke of York in an ongoing investigation by the DOJ. *   The firm alleges the DOJ, specifically Geoffrey S. Berman, has used the Duke's assistance for publicity rather than genuine investigation. *   The DOJ initially requested the Duke's help in January 2020, but subsequently made public statements about a “wall of silence” and lack of cooperation. *   The firm highlights a broken promise of confidentiality and a refusal to apologize for the DOJ’s actions. *   Due to these issues, the Duke has decided to cease cooperating with the investigation. *   The firm requests that the recipient treat the email as private and confidential.

An email chain, dated February 25, 2020, was sent from “USANYS” to Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) regarding an investigation into Prince Andrew. The chain contains two attachments: “U.S. Department of Justice Investigation” and “DOJ ongoing Investigation,” which cover the initial outreach and subsequent emails related to the investigation. The sender believes these attachments encompass the entirety of the relevant communications.

On March 13, 2020, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) received emails regarding an investigation into the Jeffrey Epstein Estate and Southern Country International Bank in the US Virgin Islands. An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the District of the Virgin Islands initiated contact to coordinate with Berman’s office, requesting a point of contact within the SDNY unit. The USVI team, comprised of FBI and IRS-CI, was conducting an investigation, seeking to avoid interference with any existing investigations. Berman responded, suggesting coordination through contacting the VI-USAO Senior Litigation Counsel.  A follow-up email on March 4th reiterated the need for coordination and a designated contact person.

Stephanie Pagones of FOX Business contacted Geoffrey Berman regarding a story about the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew’s lack of cooperation. The story highlighted Berman’s public comments on the matter, which were considered unusual due to a guideline in the U.S. Attorney’s Manual advising against commenting. Former U.S. Attorneys indicated they would likely have taken a similar action, and Pagones inquired if Berman would provide a statement for inclusion in the story by 4 p.m. Monday.

Virgin Islands. *   The investigation includes examining Epstein’s jail calls and custodial materials, potentially issued through grand jury subpoenas. *   Communication occurs between Nate (Assistant U.S. Attorney, District of the Virgin Islands) and Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) to coordinate efforts and identify a contact person within Sony. *   The FBI and IRS-CI are also participating in the investigation. *   The initial inquiry was prompted by a USVI-based FBI and IRS-CI team opening an investigation into the estate and bank.

A recording details a conversation between Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) and [REDACTED] regarding an article describing Ghislaine Maxwell massaging Ms. Maxwell’s breasts. The recording recounts Ms. Maxwell’s account of the event, including her initial hesitation, subsequent consent, and feelings of discomfort.  During the massage, Maxwell had Ms. Maxwell lie on her back while exposing her breasts under a sheet.  [REDACTED] reported a feeling of Jeffrey Epstein’s presence during the massage. Berman requested a specific quote from the New York Times related to this event.

On April 15, 2020, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) exchanged emails with [REDACTED] regarding a complaint involving Ghislaine Maxwell. The complaint centered around Maxwell performing a massage on another individual, during which she repeatedly asked if the individual wanted a massage and ultimately had them remove their clothes and bra while under a sheet. The individual felt uncomfortable and perceived the presence of Jeffrey Epstein in the vicinity. The exchange included a request for the NYT article quote about Maxwell massaging her breasts.
Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent a prosecution memo dated May 1, 2020, titled “2020-04-10 GM prosecution memo.pdf” to [REDACTED]. The memo is associated with EFTA00030003.
Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) requested a meeting regarding Epstein’s property on Friday, May 21, 2020. The response was affirmative from an unknown sender (USANYS).

Geoffrey Berman sent an email confirming receipt of a clip (“Maxwell Clip”) consisting of an email exchange and a MOV file. The exchange involves a discussion about whether the recipient gave massages to Mr. Epstein, repeatedly stating they did not, including denying giving Epstein a massage at any of his properties. The clip is associated with a “pros memo” transcript.

A correspondence between [REDACTED] and Geoffrey Berman (IJSANYS) regarding case EFTA00025071 is documented. Attached chains of communication, including one from June 8, 2020, and one from February, are included.

Attorney Geoffrey Berman of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sent an email to Barr confirming the Department of Justice’s desire for Prince Andrew to provide evidence in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The email was dated June 8, 2020.

Geoffrey Berman contacted Gretchen Shappert, U.S. Attorney for the Virgin Islands, regarding coordination issues between the SDNY and USVI investigations into the Jeffrey Epstein matter. Shappert requested assistance directing her to a supervisor within Berman’s office to discuss these issues.

Gretchen Shappert, the U.S. Attorney for the Virgin Islands, contacted Geoffrey Berman, seeking assistance with coordination issues between the SDNY and USVI investigations concerning the Jeffrey Epstein matter. She requested a referral to one of Berman’s supervisors to discuss the situation.

This email, dated June 12, 2020, discusses the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein. An attached document, “JEUIrst_indictment,_final.docx,” appears to be the finalized indictment. Geoffrey Berman is copied on the email.

*   **Geoffrey Berman’s Resistance:** Former U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman resisted attempts to explain his ouster, citing administrative staff limitations. *   **Weinstein Attorneys’ Tactics:** Harvey Weinstein’s attorney, Donna Rotunno, defended her press tactics during the trial, leading to a gag order. *   **False COVID-19 Vaccine Scheme:** A Kentucky judge ordered the shutdown of a website offering a nonexistent COVID-19 vaccine in exchange for bitcoin. *   **Supreme Court Dissent Analysis:** The text details several significant dissenting opinions from the Supreme Court, primarily related to Trump administration policies. *   **Weinstein Accuser Opposition:** Harvey Weinstein accusers opposed the $18.9 million settlement deal, describing it as a "cruel hoax." *   **DOJ Shutdown of Fraudulent Website:** The DOJ shut down a website promoting a nonexistent COVID-19 vaccine. *   **Mallinckrodt FCA Settlement:** Mallinckrodt sought to dismiss False Claims Act claims related to its Acthar Gel drug. *   **Sports & Betting Scandal:** A California couple pleaded guilty in the “Varsity Blues” college admissions scandal. *   **Compliance Lessons:** An article analyzed Novartis’s Foreign Corrupt Practices Act settlement, highlighting compliance risks for life sciences companies. *   **Public Integrity Cases:** Coverage includes charges against a New York City police union boss for defrauding a retirement fund, and a Panama Papers-related defense for Netflix. *   **Legal Ethics Discussions:** The text discusses legal ethics related to the Donziger case and the allegations against NAC Foundation. *   **Business Development Strategies:** An article suggests associates prioritize business development despite the pandemic. *   **Legal Industry News:** Updates include Deloitte expanding its legal business services, concerns about the future of the legal industry, and developments related to Facebook’s investigation and Boies Schiller adding bankruptcy attorneys. *   **Court Decisions:** Several court decisions are reported, including the Sixth Circuit upholding an opioid pill mill operator’s conviction and Foley & Lardner gaining standing to foreclose on a condo loan. *   **Notable Figures & Interviews:** The text includes an interview with Spartan Race’s general counsel, Deanna Sheridan, discussing the challenges of running events during the pandemic. *   **Job Postings:** Several attorney job openings are listed, including positions at the SEC, KLR Davis, and Schoen Legal Search.

U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman announced the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell for allegedly aiding Jeffrey Epstein’s sex crimes. This follows an earlier indictment of Epstein for similar offenses. Epstein’s suicide did not prevent the pursuit of justice for the victims, who have courageously come forward and played a critical role in securing the charges against Maxwell. The case highlights the principle that justice is impartial regardless of wealth or power, and that individuals who abuse young women will be held accountable.
